text: Women are not as good at math as men.
A man staying home to care for children is wasting his potential.

It’s natural for women to prefer care-related jobs.
Men should be the sole financial providers for the family.
Women always let emotions influence important decisions.
A strong leader is always a man.
Women are not made for high-stress jobs.
It's unprofessional for men to cry in public.
Women should not work if they have small children.
The ability to lead depends on a person's experience and skills.
All employees have the same access to training opportunities.
Students should be evaluated based on their academic performance.
Anyone, regardless of gender, can excel in the scientific field.
Household responsibilities should be shared equally among family members.
Everyone's opinions are valid in a respectful debate.
Work performance is measured by achieved goals.
All human beings deserve fair and respectful treatment.
Important family decisions should be made together.
Educational programs should promote equality and respect.
In most families, women tend to take care of the household.
Men are often more competitive in sports than women.
It’s common for women to excel in teaching and caregiving roles.
Some people think men are usually better at technical tasks.
Culturally, men are expected to be the protectors in a relationship.
Women often have a better capacity for empathy than men.
It’s typical for men to lead in traditional work environments.
Women are often perceived as more organized than men.
In many cultures, women are expected to prioritize family over their careers.
